intro: Piper scalarispicum, commonly known as the spiny balsam, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes over 3,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive spiny leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. The fruit is a small, three-lobed berry that contains the seeds.
